    Big operators #

    In this file we define products and sums indexed by finite sets (specifically, Finset).

    Notation #

    We introduce the following notation.

    Let s be a Finset , and f : a function.

    • x s, f x is notation for Finset.prod s f (assuming is a CommMonoid)
    • x s, f x is notation for Finset.sum s f (assuming is an AddCommMonoid)
    • x, f x is notation for Finset.prod Finset.univ f (assuming is a Fintype and is a CommMonoid)
    • x, f x is notation for Finset.sum Finset.univ f (assuming is a Fintype and is an AddCommMonoid)

    Implementation Notes #

    The first arguments in all definitions and lemmas is the codomain of the function of the big operator. This is necessary for the heuristic in @[to_additive]. See the documentation of to_additive.attr for more information.

    source
    theorem Finset.prod_eq_fold { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} [CommMonoid ] (s : Finset ) (f : ) :
    x s, f x = fold (fun (x1 x2 : ) => x1 * x2) 1 f s
    source
    theorem Finset.sum_eq_fold { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} [AddCommMonoid ] (s : Finset ) (f : ) :
    x s, f x = fold (fun (x1 x2 : ) => x1 + x2) 0 f s
    source
    theorem MonoidHom.coe_finset_prod { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} { : Type u_5} [MulOneClass ] [CommMonoid ] (f : * ) (s : Finset ) :
    ( x s, f x) = x s, (f x)
    source
    theorem AddMonoidHom.coe_finset_sum { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} { : Type u_5} [AddZeroClass ] [AddCommMonoid ] (f : + ) (s : Finset ) :
    ( x s, f x) = x s, (f x)
    source
    @[simp]
    theorem MonoidHom.finset_prod_apply { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} { : Type u_5} [MulOneClass ] [CommMonoid ] (f : * ) (s : Finset ) (b : ) :
    ( x s, f x) b = x s, (f x) b

    See also Finset.prod_apply, with the same conclusion but with the weaker hypothesis f :

    source
    @[simp]
    theorem AddMonoidHom.finset_sum_apply { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} { : Type u_5} [AddZeroClass ] [AddCommMonoid ] (f : + ) (s : Finset ) (b : ) :
    ( x s, f x) b = x s, (f x) b

    See also Finset.sum_apply, with the same conclusion but with the weaker hypothesis f :

    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.prod_cons { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [CommMonoid ] (h : a s) :
    x cons a s h, f x = f a * x s, f x
    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.sum_cons { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [AddCommMonoid ] (h : a s) :
    x cons a s h, f x = f a + x s, f x
    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.prod_insert { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [CommMonoid ] [DecidableEq ] :
    a s x insert a s, f x = f a * x s, f x
    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.sum_insert { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [AddCommMonoid ] [DecidableEq ] :
    a s x insert a s, f x = f a + x s, f x
    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.prod_insert_of_eq_one_if_not_mem { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [CommMonoid ] [DecidableEq ] (h : a s f a = 1) :
    x insert a s, f x = x s, f x

    The product of f over insert a s is the same as the product over s, as long as a is in s or f a = 1.

    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.sum_insert_of_eq_zero_if_not_mem { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [AddCommMonoid ] [DecidableEq ] (h : a s f a = 0) :
    x insert a s, f x = x s, f x

    The sum of f over insert a s is the same as the sum over s, as long as a is in s or f a = 0.

    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.prod_insert_one { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [CommMonoid ] [DecidableEq ] (h : f a = 1) :
    x insert a s, f x = x s, f x

    The product of f over insert a s is the same as the product over s, as long as f a = 1.

    source
    @[simp]
    theorem Finset.sum_insert_zero { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s : Finset } {a : } {f : } [AddCommMonoid ] [DecidableEq ] (h : f a = 0) :
    x insert a s, f x = x s, f x

    The sum of f over insert a s is the same as the sum over s, as long as f a = 0.

    ( x insert a s, f x) / f a = x s, f x

    theorem Finset.prod_disjUnion { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {s s : Finset } {f : } [CommMonoid ] (h : Disjoint s s) :
    x s.disjUnion s h, f x = ( x s, f x) * x s, f x

    x s.disjUnion s h, f x = x s, f x + x s, f x

    theorem Finset.prod_disjiUnion { : Type u_1} { : Type u_3} { : Type u_4} {f : } [CommMonoid ] (s : Finset ) (t : Finset ) (h : (s).PairwiseDisjoint t) :

    theorem Finset.prod_univ_pi { : Type u_1} { : Type u_4} [CommMonoid ] [DecidableEq ] [Fintype ] { : Type u_6} (t : (i : ) Finset ( i)) (f : ((i : ) i univ i) ) :
    x univ.pi t, f x = x Fintype.piFinset t, f fun (a : ) (x_1 : a univ) => x a

    Taking a product over univ.pi t is the same as taking the product over Fintype.piFinset t. univ.pi t and Fintype.piFinset t are essentially the same Finset, but differ in the type of their element, univ.pi t is a Finset ( a univ, t a) and Fintype.piFinset t is a Finset ( a, t a).

    theorem Finset.sum_image_of_disjoint { : Type u_6} { : Type u_7} { : Type u_8} [DecidableEq ] [AddCommMonoid ] [PartialOrder ] [OrderBot ] {f : } {g : } (hg_bot : g = 0) {I : Finset } (hf_disj : (I).PairwiseDisjoint f) :
    s image f I, g s = i I, g (f i)

    A version of Finset.sum_map and Finset.sum_image, but we do not assume that f is injective. Rather, we assume that the images of f are disjoint on I, and g = 0. The conclusion is the same as in sum_image.
